review_blob: Bottle #2702 - So I pretty much gave up on rating.  Why?  I got bored to be honest - at some point its just ticking rather than love of the beverage and I had to stop despite numerous beers I had already rated, but never entered.  Its just not fair, and I can only drink for enjoyment....but this is an exception as its my last real unrated gem in the cellar.  Nice burnt orange/brown color with no head.  Aroma of thick Grade B maple syrup, brown sugar, cereal, caramel, and confectionary sugar.  Flavor is solid maple syrup, tawny port (with a good deal of alcohol), burnt/carmelized apples, brown sugar, and plenty of sweet aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is really nice, but peters out a bit towards the end.  Overall a fantastic beverage, worthy of critical acclaim.  A real shame this was never made again, but thats what makes it special.  Rating was fun - had a real blast, but enjoying a good beer without too much thought is far better.  Ratebeer still rules - glad to have contributed a few.

Muddy brown color with a light head.  Aroma of hot chocolate, marshmellows and assorted chocolates and choco-kids cereals, and cream.  Flavor has some light vanilla, bourbon, marshmallows cocoa, chocolates and light latte.  Nice feel - very unique, well put together and tasty as hell.  Awesome.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Darker brown color with light carbonation.  Aroma is mildly sour with some barrel notes, yeast, and vinous fruits.  Flavor has a chocolate- sour taste works well.  Bits of roast, wine barrel, vinous fruits, and cocoa.  Lighter mouthfeel, but still of good quality.  Could use a bit more carbonation to pull it all together.  Nice beer, but it lacked the "oomph" of a CdT or Sinners 08.

Bottle #356/450 from JdubFL - thanks man!  This one has a nice dark brown color with a reddish hue and a small amount of carbonation.  Aroma starts with classic stick-your-nose-in-the barrel woody, bourbon goodness with roast, vanilla, and burnt cherries.  Flavor starts with a big roasty-woodsy taste plus caramel, vanilla, chocolate, more wood and bourbon, and toast.  Possibly earthy hops at the end, but not much.  The Big sound seems most dominant followed by RIS, but I could be mistaken.  Wonderfully complex and a very nice mouthfeel.  Another dynamite BA brew from CCB - awesome stuff!

1995 vintage - Fairly flat pour with a cloudy, reddish-brown color.  Nice caramel and cereal sweetness with dark fruit, citrus, and sugar.  Flavor has a nice burnt-sugar, vinous fruit sweetness.  Nice mouthfeel.  Really good , but I would like more complexity.
beer_name: Eldridge Pope Thomas Hardys Ale (all vintages to 1999)

review_blob: 2007 vintage -  This one has a nice reddish color with a roasty, sweet, caramel/hop aroma.  Lots of alcohol and sweetness with some hop remnants and sugar.  Nice overall, but fairly average for the style.

Bottle from JdubFL - thanks!  Reddish-brown pour with an aroma of vanilla, bourbon, dark fruits and brown sugar.  Flavor has maple, vanilla/wood/bourbon, chocolate, dark fruits, and assorted sweet goodies.  Monster mouthfeel - this is awesome and gives Alesmiths BA Wee Heavy a run for its money.
beer_name: Cigar City Big Sound Scotch Ale - Bourbon Barrel Aged

review_blob: Bottle from JdubFL - thanks!  Nice darker brown with a killer Rye/chocolate/hop aroma.  Flavor is rye and hop dominant, but the roasty and sweets balance this nicely.  Very pleasant mouthfeel.  Best rye-based brew Ive had in awhile.
beer_name: Cigar City Improv Imperial Dark Rye Ale

review_blob: Draft @ Capones.  Interesting reddish-brown color with a spicy, rye-cherry aroma that is quite inviting.  Flavor went from rye and hop bitterness to sweet and back.  Lots of spices here to confuse the palate.  Cool to try, but not really my thing - too many pumpkin beers have ruined me for this style in 09.

Draft and bottle from capones.  Blackish pour with an oh-so inviting aroma of dark chocolate, roast, and a bit off coffee and hops.  Flavor is very roasty and hop dominant for an IS, but damn tasty.  Solid feel and finish.  Thank god we can get this stuff in PA!
beer_name: Cigar City Marshal Zhukovs Imperial Stout

review_blob: Draft @ Capones.  Great glolden-orange color with a solid citrusy hop blast in the nose.  Citrus and tropical flavors abound in what has to be my favorite new IPA to hit PA in awhile.  Balanced, tasty, awesome.
beer_name: Cigar City Jai Alai India Pale Ale

review_blob: Draft @ Capones.  Brown color with a sweet roasty aroma of caramel, sugar, and light hops.  Flavor is sweet and malt dominant with just a hint of hops.  Very well balanced and quite tasty.
beer_name: Cigar City Bolita Double Nut Brown Ale

review_blob: Amber-gold with a nice floral, citrus hop aroma.  Flavor is thick and chewey with hops - earth, flowers, citrus, and tobacco abound.  Plenty of malt as well.  Nice and chewy with a thick mouthfeel.  Nice IPA.

Darker brown color with a light head.  Aroma is filled with roasty, burnt caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, creme brulee, and vanilla.  Flavor is a great mix of vanilla, light oak/bourbon, warm caramel, vinous fruit, and raw sugar.  Nice mouthfeel that gets better as it warms.  Truly a beer that is great at cellar temps and will hopefully be a recurring brew.  Cheers to the Bruery for crafting a fine brew worthy of praise and redefining what such a style can be!

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Dark brown with some reddish hints and almost no carbonation.  Aroma is quite pleasant - lots of vanilla, wood, bourbon, chocolates, and a bit of creaminess.  Flavor is quite nice with lots of vanilla, chocolate, and a light woody bourbon that is of high quality.  Mouthfeel is nice with a little sting.  Wood & base beer are very well integrated.  It seems easy to shit on LA these days with the carbonation issues, etc. but this is spot on for me as far as aroma/flavor for a BA stout.  I dinged it for having no carbonation, but it wouldnt need much to match up with a BCS or similar top notch BA impy stout.  Very nice regardless of carbonation level.
beer_name: Port Brewing Santas Little Helper - Bourbon Barrel

review_blob: Brownish in color with a roasty, malty aroma that is quite inviting.  Flavor has some nice breadiness and light hops with a pleasant finish.  Its still a mild, but damn good for the style.
Reddish-brown color with a subtle malty-cherry aroma.  Flavor had some light maltiness, cherry, and a slightly acidic finish.  Ok, but I was hoping for more.
Cask - darker brown color with a roasty, chocolatey aroma.  Flavor of roast, chocolate, and lacto.  Not bad, but could have been nicer.
beer_name: Rock Bottom King of Prussia Oatmeal Stout

review_blob: Darker brown with a sweet, chocolatey, roasty aroma.  Flavor of big roast, chocolate, coffee, and berry.  Big on feel, but incredibly smooth.  Maybe their best offering at KOP.
beer_name: Rock Bottom King of Prussia Czars Nightmare

review_blob: Golden-orange with a mildly hoppy and sweet aroma.  Flavor has some light sweetness with gentle hops and a solid finish.  Good, but not a standout.
beer_name: Iron Hill West Coast Gold Ale

review_blob: Lighter golden color with a big, sweet aroma of orange and some hops.  Classic tripel all the way plus hops, summer fruit and spice.  Good, but IH has put out so many beers like this lately that it gets lost in the crowd.

Golden pour with a nice size head.  Aroma of sweet banana, spice, and citrus.  Flavor has a classic W-Bock/Hefe sweetness with all of the standard fruits plus a nice dose of earthy hops and spice.  Really nice.  4.2%?!?!  My ass.

Draft @ Maple Shade and Cask @ Newark.  Nice golden color with a thick head (on the draft).  Aroma of citrus, grass, and some sweetness.  Flavor has a nice citra-grassy hop bite that I really dug and just enough maltiness.  Also a nice feel.  Definitely prefer cask on this one, but good on both.  Surprised to see it rated so low.

Darker brown color with a rather large head.  Aroma of figs, raisins, brown sugar, and various sweet flavors.  Flavor has some brown sugar, maple syrup, raisins, dates, and caramel.  Feel was OK, but lacked a real bite.  Nice, but could have been a tad more aggressive.

Growler from bgburdman9 - thanks!  Dark brown color with a rich chocolatey aroma that features a wonderful balance of fruit, coffee, and candy.  Flavor has just the right mix of chocolate, roast, coffee, cream, hops, and fruit to make it a classic.  Truly the best example of the style Ive had.

beer_brewer_name: Port Brewing Co / The Lost Abbey
review_blob: Nice darker brown with a pleasantly sour aroma of dark fruits, Cabernet and other Bordeaux varietals, wood, and sweetness.  Flavor is nice and sour with some red wine barrel, oak, wet fields, and funkiness.  Quite nice - I liked Lost and Found but this really takes it to another level.

Bottle from LilBeerDoctor - thanks!  Nice golden color with a medium puffy head.  Aroma has lots of nice citrus, raw barrel, sourness, and some infected white wine - awesome!  Flavor matches the aroma with lots of barrel and sourness, but came up just short of CdC territory.  A very nice sour that I hope to cross paths with in the future.

Golden color with a sour/funky nose that features some strawberry and assorted wild fruits.  Nice acidic-tart bite with some gentle strawberries, maybe some oak, and a solid sour finish.  Overall a nice fruit lambic.

Nice orange color with good carbonation.  Aroma of rustic apple skins with some nice sourness and wood.  Flavor is surprisingly sweet with some apples, bitter/sour notes, and a woody finish.  Not the best, but hard not to enjoy.
Darker brown with a sweet aroma of chocolate, cream and coffee. Flavor is chocolate-dominant with some nice roast and coffee.  Overall a very solid stout that I hope to see around more often.
Darker brown with a roasty, sweet, dopplebockish aroma.  Flavor of dark fruits, bread and chocolate.  Not bad, but only average for the style.
Dark brown pour with a roasty, smoky aroma that featured some chocolate.  Flavor was roasty with chocolate and coffee, but ended with some off flavors.  OK, but not highly enjoyable.
beer_name: Full Sail Top Sail Imperial Porter

review_blob: 2004 bottle - Nice looking reddish color, very port-like with no head.  Aroma of big sugar, oak, over ripe fruits, sherry, and port.  Flavor is quite sweet - a lot like GLIs 275th with overwhelming sugar, sweet and ripe tropical fruits, oxidation/sherry, wood.  Quite nice all around, but for the price you can get almost a case of Old Horizontal, which I would much prefer.  Nice for a one time treat.
Darker brown with a grasty, grainy aroma that feaures some light roast and chocolate.  Flavor is roasty, grainy, and lightly coated with chocolate.  Below average for a brewdog stout IMHO.

Bottle from bgbirdman - thanks!  2005 bottle with a nice looking brown color.  Aroma has some dubbel characteristics with light wine and barrel notes.  Flavor is more dubbel than anything, with some light oak notes, vanilla, and med-bold red wine.  Overall good, but could have been better.

Bottle from xmarcnolanx - thanks!  This one had a nice golden color that got quite cloudy on the second half of the bottle with a decent bit of fast-fading carbonation.  Aroma was fairly funky with a nice mix of gueuze and light strawberries.  Flavor had some oaky-funky gueuze-like notes with some strawberries and sourness. Nice feel.  After reading so many so-so reviews, it sounds like time is surely this beers friend.  Overall pretty good.
Light in color with a slightly tart aroma of apple and pear.  Flavor is a bit acidic, but seems more on the Perry side than cider-ish.  Seems to have gone a bit wrong.  Not very good at all.

Dark brown with a smoky aroma of roast, chocolate, vanilla, and wood.  Flavor is roasty with some wood, roast, chocolate, and light bitterness.  I wasnt crazy about this one at first, but it really shaped up nicely as it warmed.

Nice golden color with an aroma quite similar to its larger bretheren - gentle honey, floral essences, light spice and fruit too.  Flavor is lighter with some floral, wildflower honey notes and light fruit.  Nice feel.  Really not bad, but when youve had their Poltorak and Dwojniak, why settle for the weaker stuff?
Dark brown with a nice aroma of roast, chocolate, and sugar.  Flavor of chocolate, roast, and hops with a nice mouthfeel.  Nice, but could be a tad more flavorful for an impy.

Bluish color with an aroma of blueberry, mildly sweet orange blossom honey, and some yeastiness.  Flavor has some light blueberry, orange blossom and blueberry/wildflower honeys and a yeasty bite.  OK, but they could have done much better here.
Darker brown color with an aroma of plum, sugar, and cinnamon-spice.  Flavor has a sweet and spicy mix with dark fruit, sweet malt, and a solid finish.  Just OK for a quad, but really unique.
beer_name: The Bruery Partridge in a Pear Tree

review_blob: Golden color with an aroma of sweet apples and some light sugar.  Flavor is semi-sweet with a mildly acidic apple flavor.  Decent still cider.

Nice orange-gold color with some heavy legs.  Aroma is a nice, sweet apple & sugar mix with some honey notes.  Flavor has a nice viscous apple mix with some light acidity, brown sugar, and honey.  Very good, but cant quite match up to the Canadian versions.

Bottles thanks to a couple of traders - thanks!  Aroma has some nice roasty chocolate with cream and coffee hints.  Flavor has a nice hop bite with lots of roasty coffee and milky chocolate.  Nice Impy Stout.
beer_name: Ballast Point Sea Monster Imperial Stout

review_blob: Darker brown color with a medium head.  Aroma has some light roast, chocolate, adn a bit of coffee.  Flavor has some roasty chocolate and almost some cardboard.  Decent feel with an average finish.  Kind of underwhelmed by this one.

beer_brewer_name: La Face Cache de la Pomme
review_blob: 2003 bottle from a trade last year (I seem to have lost my note about who its from).  Beautiful golden color with some serious legs after swirling the glass.  Strong, sweet apple aromas, with lots of apricot, peach, and honey.  Flavor is wonderfully sweet with lots of thick apples, honey, apricots, and more "Sweetness".  Fantastic feel with wonderful tannins and acidity.  Nearly liquid heaven.  Awesome.
beer_name: La Face Cache de la Pomme Neige Rcolte DHiver

review_blob: Golden color with mild carbonation.  Aroma is solidly tart and tannic fall apples with some light sweetness.  Flavor has a nice fresh apple taste with a light apple bite.  Good cider overall.

Nice golden color with a fantastic aroma of sweet apples, honey, and tart summer fruit.  Flavor has a great tannic-sweet apple bite with honey and a great tartness that makes you want to keep drinking this one all day - I think it was around 10% abv, but I left this out of my notes.  Fantastic mouthfeel.  Best U.S. Cider Ive had hands down.

Nice brown color with a medium head.  Aroma has some sweet fruit, bread, and maybe some roast in there.  Flavor is very nice and sweet with some bread, ripe summer fruits, and a pleasant bite at the end.  Nice mouthfeel and a really nice finish.  Probably the best Longshot Ive had in any year.  Really nice offering.
